Definition at line 682 of file ppm.h.

#define PPM_PACKETNET_CB ( _name   )     void _name(ppmPacketnetHandle handle, Uns32 bytes, void *data, void *userData)

Packetnet is used to model networks which broadcast packets of data from one of many senders to all receivers. Packetnet is suitable for Ethernet, USB, CAN or GSM networks. Each receiver will be notified when a packet is received; the receiver must decide if it should use the data or not, typically by reading the first few bytes of data, then deciding by its contents if the rest of the packet should be read. Data that is NOT read in the notifier callback will be lost. A call by a sender to ppmPacketnetWrite() will block until all receivers have had their notifiers. For this reason the notifier function must not take time. Network latency, network data rate and network recovery time must be modeled by delays added to the sender's process. The order that receivers are called cannot be determined by the ppm interface, it depends on the order of connections made in the platform. Prototype for packetnet notifier. Called when a packet arrives on the given channel.

Definition at line 93 of file ppm.h.

#define PPM_RESTORE_STATE_FN ( _name   )     void _name(ppmSaveRestorePhase phase)

Prototype for callback for state restore function. This is called twice: 1. first call (phase=0), before peripheral memory has been restored; 2. second call (phase=1), after peripheral memory has been restored.

Definition at line 728 of file ppm.h.

#define PPM_SAVE_STATE_FN ( _name   )     void _name(ppmSaveRestorePhase phase)

Prototype for callback for state save function. This is called twice: 1. first call (phase=0), before peripheral memory has been saved; 2. second call (phase=1), after peripheral memory has been saved.

Definition at line 596 of file ppm.h.

typedef ppmViewValueType(* ppmCBViewValueFunc)(void *userData, void *buffer, Uns32 *bufferSize)

Type of function to be called to get the value of a view object. Callback should set bufferSize to the required size in bytes and return PPM_VVT_NOSPACE if the supplied bufferSize is too small.

Parameters:
userData Data passed to callback verbatim.
buffer Memory to receive value (large enough for all primitive types).
bufferSize Size of memory result area
Returns:
Type of value returned (PPM_VVT_ERROR if no value returned).

Definition at line 662 of file ppm.h.

typedef enum ppmSaveRestorePhaseE ppmSaveRestorePhase

Save/restore phase. The save/restore process for each peripheral is as follows:

1. the save/restore function is called with phase PPM_PRE_SAVE_RESTORE 2. the peripheral memory state is saved or restored. 3. the save/restore function is called with phase PPM_POST_SAVE_RESTORE

If a peripheral implements dynamic threads, these are typically deleted when the restore function is called with phase PPM_PRE_SAVE_RESTORE and reinstated when the restore function is called with phase PPM_POST_SAVE_RESTORE to reflect the restored memory state.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum ppmSaveRestorePhaseE

Save/restore phase. The save/restore process for each peripheral is as follows:

1. the save/restore function is called with phase PPM_PRE_SAVE_RESTORE 2. the peripheral memory state is saved or restored. 3. the save/restore function is called with phase PPM_POST_SAVE_RESTORE

If a peripheral implements dynamic threads, these are typically deleted when the restore function is called with phase PPM_PRE_SAVE_RESTORE and reinstated when the restore function is called with phase PPM_POST_SAVE_RESTORE to reflect the restored memory state.

Enumerator:
PPM_PRE_SAVE_RESTORE 
PPM_POST_SAVE_RESTORE

typedef PPM_WRITE_CB ( *  ppmCBWriteFunc  ) 
ppmExternalBusHandle ppmAccessExternalBus ( const char *  remoteBusName,
volatile void *  localLoAddress,
Uns64  sizeInBytes,
SimAddr  remoteLoAddress 
)

Create a bus bridge into an external bus address space, by bus name: Reads and writes to the address range localLoAddress:localLoAddress+sizeInBytes will be performed on the remote bus. Most peripherals will use ppmOpenExternalBusPort. This interface might be used for devices that need to create a window whose address is determined at run-time, or which needs to be changed on the fly.

Parameters:
remoteBusName Name of bus to expose.
localLoAddress Lower extent of region in this address space.
sizeInBytes Size in bytes of region in this address space.
remoteLoAddress Lower extent of region in remote address space.
Returns:
handle to exposed region (for deletion) or null.

const char *  name,
const char *  description,
ppmCBViewActionFunc  actionCB,
void *  userData 
)

description Optional one line description string.

userData Optional data passed back to action callback.

Bool ppmChangeRemoteLoAddress ( ppmExternalBusHandle  h,
SimAddr  remoteLoAddress 
)

Move the external bus window to view a different region of the remote address space. (e.g. might be used by a plug-n-play device).

Parameters:
h Handle to existing window.
remoteLoAddress New remote address.
Returns:
success/failure (if the handle is invalid or address overlaps another region).
Bool ppmCloseAddressSpace ( ppmAddressSpaceHandle  addressSpace  ) 

close address space

Parameters:
addressSpace handle to address space
Returns:
1=success/0=failure
Bool ppmCreateDynamicBridge ( const char *  slavePort,
SimAddr  slaveLoAddress,
Uns64  sizeInBytes,
const char *  masterPort,
SimAddr  masterLoAddress 
)

DYNAMIC BRIDGE INTERFACE Create a bridge between two buses connected to two ports of the peripheral. The bridge can be removed at any time. This feature is typically used for a system where address decoding can be switched at run-time (e.g. PCI).

Parameters:
slavePort Name of port connected to bus with masters
slaveLoAddress Lower address on bus with masters
sizeInBytes Size of window
masterPort Name of port connected to bus with slaves
masterLoAddress Lower address on bus with slaves
Returns:
True if OK, False if Failed.
Bool ppmCreateDynamicSlavePort ( const char *  slavePort,
SimAddr  slaveLoAddress,
Uns64  sizeInBytes,
void *  localLowAddress 
)

Create a dynamic window from a peripheral slave port onto the local memory space of the peripheral. This is like ppmExposeLocalBus() but connect by port name, rather than bus name.

Parameters:
slavePort Name of port connected to bus with masters
slaveLoAddress Lower address on bus with masters
sizeInBytes Size of window
localLowAddress Lower address on peripheral bus
Returns:
True if OK, False if Failed.

isVolatile whether to write the register even if value has not changed
void* ppmCreateSlaveBusPort ( const char *  portName,
Uns64  sizeInBytes 
)

Allocate space in the peripheral and expose it to access by another bus, described by a peripheral bus port. Primarily for use with ppmCreateRegister

Parameters:
portName name of bus port to be used to expose the bus.
sizeInBytes size of extent to be exposed.
Returns:
Address of the exposed region

)

Create a section

Parameters:
node parent node or null if root
name section header name (a few words only)
ppmDocNodeP ppmDocAddText ( ppmDocNodeP  node,
const char *  text 
)

Create a text node. The text will appear in the paragraph or section

Parameters:
node parent node
text Unformatted text content.
ppmLocalBusHandle ppmExposeLocalBus ( const char *  remoteBusName,
SimAddr  remoteLoAddress,
Uns64  sizeInBytes,
void *  localLoAddress 
)

Create a bus bridge that exposes part of the address space of the peripheral to another address space. Only use this for software controlled windows - e.g. plug&play devices. Use ppmOpenSlaveBusPort for fixed address devices - the addresses will then be visible to the simulator.

Parameters:
remoteBusName Name of bus to expose to this address space
remoteLoAddress Lower extent of region on remote bus.
sizeInBytes Size in bytes of region on remote bus.
localLoAddress Lower extent of region on this bus.
Returns:
handle to remote bus region/null.
SimAddr ppmGetAbortAddress ( void   ) 

return address causing abort of preceding bus operation initiated by ppmReadAddressSpace or ppmWriteAddressSpace, if they returned a failure status code

Returns:
aborting address
void ppmInstallChangeCallback ( ppmCBWriteFunc  cb,
void *  user,
void *  lo,
Uns32  bytes 
)

Install a callback on a write to this peripheral's mapped region that changes the written value

Parameters:
cb The write Callback function.
user User supplied argument, passed back in the callback.
lo Low address
bytes size of the region
void ppmInstallNetCallback ( ppmNetHandle  handle,
ppmCBNetFunc  cb,
void *  userData 
)

Bind a callback to a net port. This replaces any previous callback.

Parameters:
handle Handle of interrupt port.
cb function to be called when port changes state.
userData data passed to callback verbatim.

ppmAddressSpaceHandle ppmOpenAddressSpace ( char *  busPortName  ) 

Open a window onto an address space

Parameters:
busPortName name of the bus master port connected to the bus
Returns:
handle to opened address space
ppmExternalBusHandle ppmOpenMasterBusPort ( const char *  busPortName,
volatile void *  localLoAddress,
Uns64  sizeInBytes,
SimAddr  remoteLoAddress 
)

Create a bus bridge into an external bus address space by port name: Reads and writes to the address range localLoAddress:localLoAddress+sizeInBytes will be performed on the remote bus. This interface should be used for devices that need to create a window whose address is determined at run-time, or which needs to be changed on the fly.

Parameters:
busPortName Name of busPort connected to the bus to expose.
localLoAddress Lower extent of region in this address space.
sizeInBytes size in bytes of region in this address space.
remoteLoAddress Lower extent of region in remote address space.
Returns:
handle to exposed region (for deletion) or null.
ppmNetHandle ppmOpenNetPort ( const char *  portName  ) 

Return handle of an interrupt port in the context of this peripheral. Use this handle to send interrupt assert/deassert events to other devices.

Parameters:
portName Name of the interrupt port.
Returns:
Handle to interrupt port.
ppmLocalBusHandle ppmOpenSlaveBusPort ( const char *  portName,
void *  localLoAddress,
Uns64  sizeInBytes 
)

Expose part of the address space of the peripheral to an area of another address space described by a peripheral bus port.

Parameters:
portName name of bus port to be used to expose the bus.
localLoAddress lower extent of region to be exposed locally.
sizeInBytes size of extent to be exposed.
Returns:
Handle to exposed region.

Bool ppmReadAddressSpace ( ppmAddressSpaceHandle  addressSpace,
Uns64  address,
Uns32  bytes,
void *  data 
)

perform an atomic bus read operation

Parameters:
addressSpace handle to address space
address offset into the address space (added to port offset)
bytes number of bytes to read
data pointer to data to be filled
Returns:
1=success/0=failure

ppmViewValueType  type,
void *  pValue 
)

Set constant value for existing view object (value copied at time of call).

void ppmSetViewObjectRefValue ( ppmViewObject  object,
ppmViewValueType  type,
void *  pValue 
)

Set value pointer for existing view object (pointer dereferenced each time value is viewed). Use this to associate a view object with a C variable in the model such that the variable is automatically read when the view object is evaluated.

Parameters:
object Object for value.
type Type of value.
pValue Pointer to item in persistent memory (must be valid for lifetime of object)
void ppmSetViewObjectValueCallback ( ppmViewObject  object,
ppmCBViewValueFunc  valueCB,
void *  userData 
)

Set value callback for existing view object.

Parameters:
object Object for value.
valueCB Value callback function.
userData Optional data passed back to callback to allow one callback for many objects.

In a peripheral callback, signal that the write could not complete.

Bool ppmWriteAddressSpace ( ppmAddressSpaceHandle  addressSpace,
Uns64  address,
Uns32  bytes,
void *  data 
)

perform an atomic bus write operation

Parameters:

void ppmWriteNet ( ppmNetHandle  handle,
ppmNetValue  value 
)

Use this to raise an interrupt on a port, which via a platform net, is propagated to other devices which can accept an interrupt.

Parameters:
handle Handle of net port.
value New value for net signal.
